answers.answer: Its a chance you can get it i know it may scare you to get it I have it with this baby but not with my first three but I'm high risk even not being pregnant it runs on both side of both sides of my family  but eating right and watching your carb in take you should be just fine good luck

I am 17 weeks and have gestational diabetes. Luckily,  I'm only having to monitor my blood sugar 4 times a day...so far so good. Hopefully it stays this way so I won't have to go on medication or insulin. Unfortunately,  I am what they consider overweight and am predisposed.  I have to say this has kept me in check and I have no gained any weight which was expected since I'm on low carb. This has been a blessing on disguise. I have made my health my priority and will never allow myself to become overweight again.
I keep hearing "watch your carbs", but what does that mean?  How much carbs am I supposed to be eating?
I have a listing of the number of carbs I should be eating.  Do you want me to post it for you?
Yes I would appreciate that, ty :)
Breakfast 30grams (no fruit allowed)Snacks 15-30 gramsLunch 45 gramsSnack 15-30gramsDinner 45 gramsSnack 15-30 gramsI was told to not skip meals and snacks.
Breakfast 30grams (no fruit allowed)Snacks 15-30 gramsLunch 45 gramsSnack 15-30gramsDinner 45 gramsSnack 15-30 gramsI was told to not skip meals and snacks.
Ty!  So I can have fruit at the other meals and snacks just not breakfast?  Do you subtract fiber grams or do they count toward carbs?

I usually do at lunch or dinner.  I also buy the fruit cups that are sugar free for a "free snack" when I'm craving some fruit. It's my understanding you can subsitute some high fiber grams for carb grams,  but I'm unsure how to do the calculations so I don't bother. If you like bread Nature's own has some low cal, low carb whole wheat with fiber,white and honey wheat bread. I usually have one slice toasted for breakfast with 2 eggs and cheese (free carbs) of course I'm not an expert,  just been learning as I go. I still have quite a ways until my due date. It's a lot of trial and error as you learn. I also never deprive myself. I do portion control. If I want pasta and garlic bread I'll have a small portion of it and lots of salad or veggies.
But aren't veggies high in carbs?

Most veggies are low carb, (leafy greens, brocoli, cucumbers,  peppers, mushrooms etc) starcy veggies are higher in carbs (potatoes,  corn some beans etc) then again if you want potatoes or corn with your meat just ssubsitute a carb item (bread,  roll rice)
I had it with my first pregnancy but not with this one nature is a funny thing. Just keep eating rite and cross your fingers.
ty so much, I have been watching my carbs all day. kinda tough, seems like I'm used to eating a lot of carbs!  I'm doing it tho:)

question: What are the chances of getting GD at age 39?  Throw in the added factors of me being overweight and already having sugar level on the high end of normal (pre-diabetes)?
title: Risk of gestational diabetes?
